intro: Galarhoeus pekinensis, commonly known as the Peking spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
